definition: inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Some of them have inscriptions with the names of their makers.
sentences.chinese: 有些大炮上有制造者的落款。

sentences.english: They are still evolving, often awkwardly.
sentences.chinese: 依然包括落款，尽管常常显得笨拙。

sentences.english: Then I saw the dateline -- 1924. The letter had been written almost sixty years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 信的落款日期是1924年，差不多写于60年前。

definition: signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
